instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message:
when I got it, i had to replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> because it didn't get a green light and PPBUS was 0v

now I get a green light, and posts but the battery is not detected.
can run on battery once charger applied then remove the charger.

I also have replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> just in case.

diode mode on:
SCL = 0.500
SDA = 0.498


resistance between pin 17/18 and 27/28 from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
17/18 = 3.1 ohm
27/28 = 21 ohm



<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.21v on charger
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 11.39v on batt

real charger.
tested with two known working batteries.



[B]DEAD SMC?[/B]

SDA = 0.498

are near same on known working board

threads.message: Yes, but there is activity on those lines???? Check with oscilloscope....

threads.message: :( i dont have one.  these cheap USB to PC oscilloscope are they any good?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message: Also you have 12.21V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, this means SMC is not working...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message:
I've replaced the SMC. it can see the battery now.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is now at 12.58v

solved.
